name: DolarApp
headline: Latin America's global financial app
description:
DolarApp lets people in LatAm (currently Mexico, Argentina and Colombia) dollarize their everyday finances. Users can go from peso to dollar USDc (and back) in seconds, save in USDc, send and receive payments in the United States without the hassle, top up their accounts with crypto and pay with an international Mastercard at the best rates.

DolarApp was started by 3 ex Revolut guys: Fernando and Alvaro led the 2 largest P&Ls in Revolut (Crypto and Subscriptions), and worked in LatAm as consultants for BCG; Zach led the Crypto and Remittances products at Revolut, and started an identity verification startup using crypto years ago.

founders.name: Zach Garman, Founder
founders.description: I lead Product at DolarApp. Previously, I led the Crypto product for Revolut, helped to found an Ethereum-based digital identity product, and spent some time in Financial Services consulting.

founders.name: Fernando Terres, Founder
founders.description:
Co Founder and CEO at DolarApp.

Before DolarApp, I was the head of Crypto P&L at Revolut, after wearing some other hats in the organisation: Product Strategy and Operations (revamping our paid plans suite), P&L optimisation (leading key initiatives to bring the company to breakeven) and Retail Growth (doubling user base since I joined).

Before joining Revolut I was a consultant at BCG, where I worked on Corporate Strategy projects in Retail, TMT and Industry in Latin America and Spain.

generated_description:
**DolarApp: The Future of Finance in Latin America**

DolarApp is blazing a trail in the fintech landscape of Latin America, capitalizing on the pressing need for seamless financial solutions in the region. Founded in 2021 by Fernando, Alvaro, and Zach, three former Revolut executives, the company started with a clear mission: to help people in Latin America dollarize their everyday finances. 

### **What DolarApp Does**

Currently available in Mexico, Argentina, and Colombia, DolarApp allows users to easily convert their local currencies to USDC (the digital dollar) and back in mere seconds. The app simplifies everything from storing savings in USD to sending and receiving payments in the U.S. without the usual complexities. Users can even top up their accounts with cryptocurrencies and utilize an international Mastercard for smooth transactions. 

DolarApp stands out by eliminating the need for traditional currency exchange houses, which often come with hidden fees and unfavorable conversion rates. It offers transparency and a real-time exchange process that saves its users a staggering $19.1 million in commission costs.

### **Foundation and Growth**

DolarApp sees itself not just as a financial app but as a movement—one that seeks to break down financial borders. With a solid team of 26 employees operating from Mexico City, they are part of the Y Combinator Batch S21, a reflector of innovation and high potential in tech startups. Aaron Epstein serves as their Group Partner, amplifying their reach and expertise.

### **User Experience and Engagement**

Despite its youth, DolarApp has already garnered an impressive user rating of 4.7. Users appreciate its accessibility and how it aligns with modern travel and financial habits. Whether they're looking to convert pesos to digital dollars effortlessly or manage their cryptocurrency investments, DolarApp is positioned as a handy companion.

### **The Road Ahead**

As digital finance continues to evolve globally, DolarApp is poised to set an example in Latin America. It combines the latest advancements in fintech and crypto to bring financial freedom to individuals who have historically faced hurdles due to volatile local currencies. For anyone in Latin America looking to simplify their financial transactions while enjoying lower costs, DolarApp is a name worth noting.

To explore more about DolarApp and download the app, visit [DolarApp's website](https://www.dolarapp.com/). 

In a world where finance knows no boundaries, DolarApp is making it an everyday reality for its users.
